data.enText: leaned
leaned
leant
leant
to bend or move from a vertical position
data.chText: 前俯（或后仰）；倾斜

data.enText: I leaned back in my chair.
data.chText: 我仰靠在椅背上。

data.enText: The tower is leaning dangerously.
data.chText: 那座塔越来越斜，很危险。

data.enText: A man was leaning out of the window.
data.chText: 一个人正探身窗外。

data.enText: to rest on or against sth for support
data.chText: 倚靠；靠在；靠置

data.enText: A shovel was leaning against the wall.
data.chText: 一把铁铲靠墙放着。

data.enText: She walked slowly, leaning on her son's arm.
data.chText: 她倚靠着她儿子的手臂缓慢行走。

data.enText: to make sth rest against sth in a sloping position
data.chText: 使斜靠

data.enText: Can I lean my bike against the wall?
data.chText: 我能把自行车靠在这墙上吗？

data.enText: lean on sb/sth
to depend on sb/sth for help and support
data.chText: 依靠，依赖（…的帮助和支持）

data.enText: He leans heavily on his family.
data.chText: 他在很大程度上依赖他的家庭。

data.enText: to try to influence sb by threatening them
data.chText: 对…施加压力；威胁；恐吓

data.enText: The government has been leaning on the TV company not to broadcast the show.
data.chText: 政府一直给电视公司施加压力，不准播放此节目。

data.enText: lean to/towards/toward sth
to have a tendency to prefer sth, especially a particular opinion or interest
data.chText: 倾向，偏向（尤指某意见或利益）

data.enText: The UK leant towards the US proposal.
data.chText: 英国倾向于美国的提案。

data.enText: leaner
leanest
without much flesh; thin and fit
data.chText: 肉少的；瘦且健康的

before.enText: of people, especially men, or animals

data.enText: a lean, muscular body
data.chText: 清瘦而肌肉发达的身体

data.enText: He was tall, lean and handsome.
data.chText: 他长得瘦高而英俊。

data.enText: containing little or no fat
data.chText: 脂肪少的；无脂肪的

data.enText: difficult and not producing much money, food, etc.
data.chText: 难以赚钱的；生产不出（食物等）的；贫乏的

data.enText: a lean period/spell
data.chText: 不景气时期

data.enText: The company recovered well after going through several lean years .
data.chText: 经历了几年的萧条后，这家公司的业务才完全恢复了正常。

data.enText: strong and efficient because the number of employees has been reduced
data.chText: 精干的；效率高的

data.enText: The changes made the company leaner and more competitive.
data.chText: 改革使公司更精干，更有竞争力。

data.enText: the part of meat that has little or no fat
data.chText: 瘦肉

ex.enText: He was lean, tall and muscular.
He has a lean handsome face.

synonyms.bx: 尤指男人或动物瘦而健壮的。

ex.enText: All girls want to be slender.
The birch has smooth bark and slender branches.
ex.chText: 桦树有光滑的树皮和细长的树枝。

synonyms.bx: 多指女性身材修长苗条、体态优美的；形容物体时表示细或窄的。

ex.enText: Ann is a slight girl.
Her slight frame was shaken by bouts of coughing.
ex.chText: 她纤弱的身躯因阵阵咳嗽而颤抖。

ex.enText: a slim volume of prose
She is trying to get slim.
She goes for tall slim men.

synonyms.bx: 指人身材修长的，常用于减肥者；也可形容书、钱包等薄的。

ex.enText: The boy was thin for his age.
ex.chText: 就他的年龄而言，这男孩算是瘦的。

ex.enText: She is thin in the face.
She was wearing a thin gold chain.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指人或身体部位瘦削的，也可形容物体细或薄的。

ex.enText: Only when the telescope is inclined at an angle of thirty degrees can you see that star.
ex.chText: 只有当这架望远镜以30度角倾斜时，你才能看到那颗星星。

ex.enText: The wall seems to incline almost fifteen degrees.
ex.chText: 墙好像倾斜了将近15度角。

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物以某种角度或向某一方向倾斜。

ex.enText: He leaned forward and tried to catch what they were talking about.
ex.chText: 他身体前倾，想听他们在谈论什么。

ex.enText: She was leaning against a tree, waiting for her boyfriend.
ex.chText: 她正倚着一棵树等她男朋友。

ex.enText: Don't lean your bicycle against the door.
ex.chText: 别把自行车斜靠在门上。

synonyms.bx: 指某人身体前倾或某物倾斜，也可指（使）人或物倚靠在另一人或物之上。

ex.enText: Rays of the sun slanted through the window.
He slanted his skis a little more to the right.
ex.chText: 他把滑雪板略微向右斜了一点。

synonyms.bx: 指某物歪斜或使某物产生一定的角度。

ex.enText: The floor of the bathroom slopes down to the drain.
ex.chText: 浴室的地面向排水口倾斜。

ex.enText: The road slopes sharply at this point.

synonyms.bx: 指地面或其他表面倾斜。

ex.enText: She tilted her head and smiled.
You can see his mouth tilt upwards slightly at the corners.
ex.chText: 你可以看见他的嘴角微微翘起。

ex.enText: The little boy tilted his chair back.

synonyms.bx: 尤指头、下巴等身体部位倾斜或使其倾斜。

data.enText: lean on sb/sth
to depend on sb/sth for help and support
data.chText: 依靠，依赖（…的帮助和支持）

data.enText: He leans heavily on his family.
data.chText: 他在很大程度上依赖他的家庭。

data.enText: to try to influence sb by threatening them
data.chText: 对…施加压力；威胁；恐吓

data.enText: The government has been leaning on the TV company not to broadcast the show.
data.chText: 政府一直给电视公司施加压力，不准播放此节目。

data.enText: lean to/towards/toward sth
to have a tendency to prefer sth, especially a particular opinion or interest
data.chText: 倾向，偏向（尤指某意见或利益）

data.enText: The UK leant towards the US proposal.
data.chText: 英国倾向于美国的提案。

data.enText: bend/lean over backwards (to do sth)
to make a great effort, especially in order to be helpful or fair
data.chText: 尽力；竭力

data.enText: I've bent over backwards to help him.
data.chText: 我已尽最大努力帮助他。

tr: the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the vertical
example: the tower had a pronounced tilt
the ship developed a list to starboard
he walked with a heavy inclination to the right
We can lean on this man
He leaned his rifle against the wall

tr: to incline or bend from a vertical position
cause to lean to the side
have a tendency or disposition to do or be something
example: She tends to be nervous before her lectures
you can't be too rich or too thin
Yon Cassius has a lean and hungry look"-Shakespear

tr: lacking in mineral content or combustible material

value.boxr_value: American English uses the form leaned as the past tense and past participle. British 	English uses either leaned or leant. 美国英语用leaned作过去式和过去分词，英国英语则用leaned或leant。

example.ex: Eileen leaned across and opened the passenger door...
example.tran: 艾琳倾身把后座门打开。

example.ex: He leaned forward to give her a kiss...
They stopped to lean over a gate.
example.tran: 他们停下来，趴在一扇大门前。

value.def: When you lean in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction.

example.ex: She was feeling tired and was glad to lean against him...
example.tran: 她正感到有些疲倦，因此很高兴可以靠在他身上。

example.ex: Lean the plants against a wall and cover the roots with peat...
example.tran: 把植物靠墙摆放，用泥煤盖住根部。

example.ex: The table lurched as a young man leant his weight on it.
example.tran: 一个小伙子把身体往上一靠，桌子就歪了。

value.def: If you lean on or against someone or something, you rest against them so that they partly support your weight. If you lean an object on or against something, you place the object so that it is partly supported by that thing.

example.ex: Like most athletes, she was lean and muscular...
example.tran: 跟大部分运动员一样，她身形清瘦，肌肉结实。

example.ex: She watched the tall, lean figure step into the car.
example.tran: 她看着那个瘦高个儿上了车。

value.def: If you describe someone as lean, you mean that they are thin but look strong and healthy.

example.ex: It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.
...the leanest ground beef you can get.
example.tran: 买得到的最瘦的碎牛肉

value.def: If meat is lean, it does not have very much fat.

example.ex: The value of the pound will force British companies to be leaner and fitter.
example.tran: 英镑目前的汇率将迫使英国公司厉行精兵简政。

example.ex: ...cutting corporate flab and building leaner companies.
example.tran: 削减企业赘肉，建立瘦身型公司

value.def: If you describe an organization as lean, you mean that it has become more efficient and less wasteful by getting rid of staff, or by dropping projects which were unprofitable.

example.ex: With fewer tourists in town, the taxi trade is going through its leanest patch for 30 years.
example.tran: 随着城里游客的减少，出租车行业正遭受30年来最不景气的时期。

value.def: If you describe periods of time as lean, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful than they used to be.

trans: 同 lean manufacturing；精益生产(或制造)
向前倾；前倾；他身子前倾；探身过去；身体前倾
向后靠；向后倾斜；后仰；往后靠；向后仰
稀混合气；贫燃料混合物；贫油混合气；稀油混合；稀混合物
探出；身体深处；身子探出
